title: [Task] - add release dates to the help portal and consider a customer mailing list for new releases.
description: Can I add a suggestion for help.marklogic.com, would it be possible display the release dates of versions and also actually sign up to be notified when a new build is release as at the moment I just randomly check the portal every now and again.

changeHistory.comment:
Just to clarify, the request is for the date that a release was published - correct?  (as we do not publish future release dates).  What is the problem / issue that is being solved regarding publishing release dates?  If they just want to know if a newer version is available, they can just compare version #'s.

Being notified of a new release is a reasonable request, but it most likely will require processes and resources to monitor that we stay current.  Need to consider if we want to actually sign ourselves up with that responsibility. 

I changed the bugtrack type to RFE

Hi Rick,

My interpretation of this is that it's a request for an extra column outlining the release date - so, for example - the extra column containing the information for 5.0-5 would have a "Release Date" of "4th March 2013".  I don't think RSC are asking for us to list future releases and I understand that this is something we would never do (to be honest, I don't think they care too much about future releases; just information on current releases).

I think the notification aspect may go hand in hand with the first part of the request where a group email is issued to anyone who opts in (I think we should definitely make people opt in rather than spam every customer with this) and this would have of a workflow of:

- Updating the table on help.ml.com
- Generating an email making customers aware

For each new release.

I think RSCs concern is that they have to check the page every once in a while to see whether there is a new maintenance release; even when they do this, they have no idea when the maintenance release was made available on DMC.

Hope this clarifies - let's talk about this at some stage and prioritise accordingly.

Best,
A

Part 1: Add a column for actual release date in the Supported Server Versions display is a good idea and we should implement.

Part 2:  We currently send emails to all support contacts that have not opted out (do not send list).  We can not change to an opt-in model as customers may be relying on the current model.  RSC may have been frustrated as we did not have a consistent policy on this previously.  Notifying customers of new maintenance releases is now part of the the MR checklist. Suggest deferring any action on the opt-in notification feature for now.

Part 1: done - released date is now published in the supported versions display.
Part 2 is handled by emails to all support contacts.
